bibl.title: The Territory of Washington vs. Donald Fallon and Frank Rogers. Return
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archive, Puget Sound Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: King County Government, Judicial Administration, Territorial District Court Case Files, 1867-1889

div1.p: In the District Court of the 3rd Judicial District of Washington Territory held at Seattle in and for the counties of King and Kitsah In the matter of the application of Donald Fallon and Frank Rogers for discharge Habeaus Corpus And more comes the said Donald Fallon and Frank Rogers and their attorneys C. J. Jury & B. P. Eileen and Bork ann for answer to the return of L. V. Wyckoff the deputy marshall W. J. say that the said return is not sufficient and in this that the writ of Habeaus Corpus is issued and to Louis V. Wyckoff as Sherrif of the King County and the L. V. Wyckoff the said deputy marshall. that as appears by the commitments attached to said return the said L. V. Wyckoff has no authority to inform or

detain said Donald Fallon and Frank Rogers or with of them in his custody.
And for answers to said return said Donald Fallon and Frank Rogers say that they share both the from Sand Fransico California to the part of the territory of Washington. That is as still prisioners of their holding to same such this day on in truth am in first they an put such hours worn on hand said that before preceeding on the said voyage from San Fransico the as foreseen they they or others of them with an agreement in

writing in the master of said Burk Doug Purth. That the article of of agreement signed by your petitioners are signed by them after onward before the said Burk Doug Purth Ian on has said that said Donald Fallons is a minor under the age of 21. The said Donald Fallon and Frank Rogers that the finding of the said Justice of the Court Smith an in accordance with the first
C D Jury
attys of petitioner

Territory of Washington County of King Donald Fallon and Frank Rogers on oath by each for himself, state they swore seal the they the sum is there.
Subscribed on the same day Donald Fallon Frank Burke on the 6th day of July A.D 1876 John J. McBihurn Marty Burke In the matter of the affliates of Habeaus Corpus Return
